result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawrence Peter Gross

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lawrence Peter Gross appeared by phone.  Attorney Michael M. Hayes appeared by video for Lawrence Peter Gross.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court with Intern Kyle Elderkin for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court on Defense's motion to suppress evidence.  Defense filed a motion to adjourn the matter due to some discovery issues.  No objection from the State.  Court scheduled a status conference.  Court approves Zoom appearances at the next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Defense Exhibits for Motion to Suppress
Received and Filed: Defense Motion to Reschedule 10-18-22 Motion Hearing
Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Lawrence Peter Gross in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes. Student Intern Kyle Elderkin with Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a motion hearing date. Defense to file any motions by 09-16-2022. Case adjourned, Branch 2 room 635 Courthouse.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Lawrence Peter Gross in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No driving without a valid license.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.

Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.

Defendant Lawrence Peter Gross in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for Scheduling Conference.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6/14/2022 @2p
